scenarioDescription:
The HD 51608 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 51608 is a star with 0.8 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 114.33 light years away from the solar system.

HD 51608 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 51608 system


HD 51608 b

HD 51608 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 51608 b is 12.784 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 51608 b is 3.620 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 51608 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 51608 c

HD 51608 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.38 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 51608 c is 14.310 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 51608 c is 3.870 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 51608 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 51608, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 51608 - System With 2 Exoplanets
